sub_title:
Senior IT Consultant | Solution Architect | Software Developer |
MSc Web Sciences and Big Data
summary:
I´m an accomplished, pragmatic, IT consultant with more than 30 years of experience at major blue-chip clients gained in the Telecoms (19 years), Insurance (10 years), Banking (2 years) and Biochemistry sectors in the UK, France, Denmark and the Netherlands with proven experience in designing, developing, and implementing, large and complex projects. 

Having recently obtained an MSc in Web Sciences and Big Data and worked with related technologies, I´m particularly interested in new opportunities in the data science and Big Data domains in any subject area. 
 
Give me a nice big problem to solve and the resources to do it and I´m happy!  

Solution Architect	 |      Senior Software Engineer	|       Functional Analysis
Data Engineer          |      Business Analysis                     |       Technical Analysis
Technical Project Manager | Trainer/Mentor			|	Test Specifications (TMAP)

Analysis and Design
•	Unified Modelling Language (UML) and Structured Systems and Design Methodology (SSADM)
•	Agile (Scrum - PSM1 Certified), Waterfall, whole lifecycle experience, CI/CD

Computer Languages, Databases and Tools (current – for older tools see individual sections) 
•	Languages: Python, C, Javascript, Ansible, COBOL, HTML5, CSS3 
•	Databases: Postgres, Neo4J, Nonstop SQL, MySQL
•	Web/Cloud Development: Django, Flask, SQL Alchemy, Docker, Kubernetes
•	Data Analytics: SciPy (Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib), Jupyter Notebook, SciKit Learn
•	Productivity: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint), Microsoft Visio, G Suite.

projects.title: Masters Thesis : Evaluation Of The Effectiveness Of Social Media Sentiment Analysis Tools When The Emoticon/Emoji Sentiment Disagrees With The Text
projects.description:
As part of the master’s in Web Science and Big Data, this project studied the effect of emojis and emoticons on nine different commercial web services that perform sentiment analysis. It covered how and to what extent emoticons and emojis affect accuracy of classification in different subject areas and how the different tools perform against each other. The contents included:

•	A parameterised web application to create test sets taken from the live Twitter stream (with or without emoticons and emojis), to test them against different sentiment analysis web services and present the results. 
•	A survey design and twelve test sets of sample Twitter data labelled by anonymous volunteers that were used to demonstrate how the tools compared.

    Distinct differences were found in how the web services used emoticons and emojis in assigning a positive or negative sentiment value to a tweet, with some services seeming to ignore their presence. Among other findings, it was discovered that web services classified polarity sensitive tweets significantly less accurately than tweets where the sentiment of the emoji/emoticon supported the sentiment of the text.

    The web application was implemented as a three-layer architecture, written using CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript (with libraries JQuery and Chartjs) and PHP. The user interface was based on the Bootstrap framework.

profile_positions.description: Consultancy providing architecture, design and development resources for IT transformation and innovation.
profile_positions.title: Information Technology Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Consultant Senior Software Engineer/Designer in the Biochemistry research domain.
•	Prototyped and implemented an application to automate the management of a large Neo4J graph database (2.5 TB) of fragmented molecule data for use in computational chemistry research. The process used a large cluster (> 1000 nodes) for the fragmentation processing and a Postgres SQL staging database for merging and deduplicating data from different vendors.
•	Evolution of the Fragalysis Chemistry research application for Diamond Light Source – the UK national synchrotron science facility - a (containerized) Django Rest Framework application running on the Openstack cloud platform. Analysed high level requirements to create detailed stories in the product backlog for the different parts of the app, then implemented the backend and API changes. Features added included Keycloak authentication and integration with the Discourse and Squonk2 applications.
•	Analysis and development of Squonk2 computational chemistry platform – a Flask-based application running in a Kubernetes cluster for running containerized workflows. 
•	Technology used: Python, Ansible, Postgres, Neo4j Docker, Nextflow, Django, Flask, AWS, Openstack, GitHub, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Swagger, OpenAPI, SQLAlchemy.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Solution design for changes to the Virgin Media Mobile Billing system based on Huawei NGBSS and Oracle Fusion middleware.
•	End to end solution designer. Responsible for writing overall functional designs for changes in the Virgin Mobile consumer domain and working with technical, functional and business stakeholders to ensure a successful and on-time implementation.
•	Major Ofcom regulatory project to improve number porting experience for consumers. Involved changes to Huawei NGBSS, Online applications, changes to API calls to 3rd party applications, contracts, reporting, revenue assurance, retentions and monitoring.  

 More information on the changes can be found here: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/media-releases/2019/end-it-with-a-text-mobile-switching
profile_positions.title: Senior Solution Designer (Freelance)

profile_positions.description:
Innovation/maintenance of the KPN Mobile Customer care and Billing system (MCCS). At its´ peak this system charged and billed more than 60 million calls per day with a turnover of more than EUR 2.75 billion per year. Now being replaced by Huawei NGBSS.

Roles performed:
•	Technical Project Manager - Controlling all planning aspects of a release including work allocation, tracking and controlling fault fixing through to implementation. 
•	Lead Architect. Responsible for writing, maintaining and implementing detailed technical designs and estimating work for projects up to 1200 man-days in size. Requires understanding of high level concepts, low level design and performance issues. 
•	Trainer. Responsible for writing and delivering a training course and expert workshops to successfully integrate 10 offshore programmers into the project. Delivery of functional training for users of system.
•	Business Analyst/Functional Analyst. Writing and maintaining business requirement specifications, impact analysis and test specifications (TMAP). 
•	CMMi level 3 project (formerly CMM level 5) ensuring low fault levels, controlled budgets,  continuity of service and pro-active risk management in conjunction with client.
•	Introduction of Agile/Scrum process to replace waterfall model (based on Rational Unified Process).
•	Senior developer: HP Nonstop C, COBOL, SQL and Eclipse/Java for Autotest replacement project (used Rational Test Workbench) 
•	Research of related BSS solutions such Oracle Portal and Jasper Wireless.
•	Key member of a team involved in 35 successful upgrades of the software – on time and on budget.

Projects included:
•	Pre-migration functionality to synchronise billing systems, perform statistical analysis of current usage of system and risk analysis
•	SEPA legislation changes
•	Fundamental accounting changes
•	Data privacy legislation changes
•	Major rating and billing enhancements 
•	Re-engineering for performance

profile_positions.title: Solution Architect | Business Analyst - Telfort

profile_positions.description:
Innovation and Maintenance of the KPN Mobile Customer care and Billing system (MCCS) based on the OSS/BSS MARS system.

Roles performed include:
•	Solution design, Impact Analysis documents and Test specifications (using the TMAP testing method).
•	Lead designer for major enhancements (up to 900 man days) to the complex charging structure for calls to the KPN network. 
•	Senior developer. Using mainly Tandem (HP nonstop) SQL COBOL and C, develop applications to a high standard with extremely low fault levels. 
•	Supported team intranet (HTML, PHP, Intrabase SQL)
•	Technical project lead for major hardware migration. 

Projects included several complex business changes to the CRM, rating and billing functional areas, major accounting enhancements, legislation changes including SOx, hardware upgrades and performance improvements. Specific areas of expertise included rating processing changes and bundles.
